alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Coastal Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:59AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeast Horry, southern Brunswick, and southern Horry counties through 645 AM EDT... At 558 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms from north of Little River, SC to near Silver Lake, NC. These storm are producing very heavy rain and cloud to ground lightning. Some ponding of water on poorly drained roadways and low-lying areas is possible. These thunderstorms are moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy Rain, Lightning, and gusty winds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain will likely produce ponding of water on roadways and in low-lying areas. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, North Myrtle Beach, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Caswell Beach, Snows Cut, Little River, South Masonboro Island, Ocean Crest Pier, Yaupon Beach, North Myrtle Beach Airport, North Masonboro Island, Iredell and Boiling Spring Lakes. This includes the following highways... US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 37. SC Highway 31 between mile markers 18 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
